subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etym}}
{{liushu|p}}: a sun ({{l|zh|日}}) above three humans ({{l|zh|㐺}}) – people gathered or working under the sun.

The top, originally {{zh-l|*日|sun}} in oracle script has been modified, in bronze script resembling instead a horizontal eye (early form of {{zh-l|*目}}) – reinterpreted as “a crowd under someone’s gaze”, and now resembles {{zh-l|*罒}}.

The bottom, originally three figures ({{lang|zh|人人人}}), uses various forms of {{zh-l|*人}} and {{zh-l|*亻}}, with variation depending on font.

subSections.text:
{{zh-hanzi}}

# {{†}} [[masses]]; [[people]]; [[multitude]]; [[crowd]]; [[everyone]]
# {{†}} [[everything]]; [[all]] [[matter]]s

# {{†}} [[soldier]]; [[army]]; [[troop]]s
# {{†}} [[slave]] [[labour]] in [[agriculture]]
# {{lb|zh|Buddhism}} [[number]] of [[monk]]s
# {{lb|zh|classical}} [[many]]; [[numerous]]
#: {{zh-syn|許多}}, {{zh-ant|寡}}
# {{†}} [[various]]; [[different]]
# {{†}} [[general]]; [[common]]
# 32nd [[tetragram]] of the [[Taixuanjing]]; "[[legion]]" ([[𝌥]])
